text: NSP2, is a rotavirus nonstructural RNA-binding protein that accumulates in cytoplasmic inclusions (viroplasms) and is required for genome replication. NSP2 is closely associated in vivo with the viral replicase. The non- structural protein NSP5 plays a role in the structure of viroplasms mediated by its interaction with NSP2. ==References== Category:Rotaviruses Category:Viral nonstructural proteins
title: NSP2 (rotavirus)
